definition: to report for duty/to check in/to register
to announce/to inform/report/newspaper/recompense/revenge/CL:份[fen4],張|张[zhang1]
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: I failed to report for duty on the date indicated.
sentences.chinese: 我未能在指定日期去报到。

sentences.english: However, Nani will miss Portugal's trip to Liechtenstein after sustaining a shoulder injury.
sentences.chinese: 不过纳尼因为肩膀受伤不能去国家队报到了。

sentences.english: Students should register in the International Student Office on time in accordance with the term schedule.
sentences.chinese: 专业生和语言生均须按规定时间到留学生办公室报到。

sentences.english: Control Center: Autobot twins, report to Hangar Three.
sentences.chinese: 汽车人双胞胎到三号机库报到。

sentences.english: The weighing-in will be conducted before the drawing-lots after the competitors' arrival.
sentences.chinese: 运动员报到后先称量体重，然后抽签进行编排。

sentences.english: Too excited to sleep, he had stayed up all night waiting for orientation at the English Language Institute to begin.
sentences.chinese: 他兴奋的彻夜未眠，等待着英语语言学院的报到。

sentences.english: Please arrive the Bamboo Room 10 minutes early and pay the tuition fee before the activity.
sentences.chinese: 请于活动前10分钟于幽竹厅报到，并缴交入场费。

sentences.english: Students who have not yet graduated must submit their diplomas when they report to THU, otherwise, their admission will be canceled.
sentences.chinese: 应届毕业生须于录取报到时缴交，否则取销录取资格。

sentences.english: New report, Nice to meet you.
Players must report to the starter at least 15 minutes before their tee-off time.
sentences.chinese: 选手必须至少在开球前15分钟向出发站报到。

sentences.english: We were ordered to go to the 3rd Kuybyshev infantry school.
sentences.chinese: 我们奉命到第3古比雪夫步兵学校报到。

sentences.english: Report to work in uniform following all appearance standards.
sentences.chinese: 按照所有的仪容仪表标准着制服报到。

sentences.english: The foregin spokesperson dismissed the reports about the President's health as rumors.
sentences.chinese: 那个外国发言人说关于总统健康的报到是谣言。

sentences.english: He was ordered to report for training to the artillery officers' school.
sentences.chinese: 他被命令去炮兵军官学校报到受训。

sentences.english: He just joins the Network Security Management Group today and is our new co-worker.
sentences.chinese: 他今天刚刚来网络安全小组报到，是我们的新同事。

sentences.english: Mr Lee was released on $5，000 bail and asked to report back to police tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 李先生获准以五千元保释外出，明天再返警署报到。

definition: to set out on a journey
to request leave of absence
to report to one's superiors/to appear in the news/to reply to a letter
to present/to give/to hand over/to hand in/to lay before
to return to one's unit/to go back to one's station in life
early in the morning/at dawn
to hold a meeting/to attend a meeting
to go on a journey/to leave
to report/to give an account of/report
to report/to give an account of/to collect information and report back
in the newspaper
station/encampment
the position of sth/whereabouts
to convene/to gather
roll call/to mention sb by name/(to call or praise or criticize sb) by name
at dawn/at first light/first thing in the morning
to sign up/to enter one's name/to apply/to register/to enroll/to enlist
